title.narrative: Madhya Pradesh District Roads II Sector Project

description.narrative: The project will improve about 1,500 kilometers (km) of major district roads (MDRs) in the state of Madhya Pradesh, in line with the state's road development plan for 2013-2033. It will involve upgrading MDRs to an intermediate lane width of 5.5 meters, or two lane widths of 7 meters, depending on traffic requirements; reconstruction, widening, and strengthening culverts and bridges; and maintaining the improved road assets for 5 years after construction. The project will also develop and introduce a cashless accident victim treatment facility in the state, and improve the accident response system.

participating-org.narrative: Madhya Pradesh Road Development Corporation Ltd.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: Road transport efficiency and safety in Madhya Pradesh is improved

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
Average travel time on the project roads reduced by 20% (2014 baseline: 1.75 minutes per km)

description.narrative: Road transport efficiency and safety in Madhya Pradesh is improved

title.narrative: Movement of people and goods on rehabilitated roads measured by AADT increased to 82,000 (2014 baseline: 44,000)

description.narrative: Road transport efficiency and safety in Madhya Pradesh is improved

title.narrative: Vehicle operating cost (economic) on the project roads reduced by 20% (2015 baseline: Rs9.60 per km for cars and Rs27.00 for medium trucks)

description.narrative: Road transport efficiency and safety in Madhya Pradesh is improved
